definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Come and look round our shop without commitment to buy anything.
sentences.chinese: 請隨時來我們商店轉轉，不一定非要買東西。

sentences.english: Mon . I wish I could, but I've made plans to walk around.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望我可以在這裏，但是我已經計劃出去轉轉了。

sentences.english: Are you swanning off to the suburb this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 你打算今天下午去郊外轉轉嗎？

sentences.english: Weekend with the wife to drive to the blue harbor two people walk around.
sentences.chinese: 週末跟媳婦兩個人開車去藍色港灣轉轉。

sentences.english: The mist eddied round the old castle.
sentences.chinese: 薄霧在那座古老的城堡的周圍打轉轉。

sentences.english: They were walking around the maze-like arcade and were led to my studio by a surge of positive energy which they could not explain.
sentences.chinese: 他們在商場兜兜轉轉地追尋一股特別的能量而來的。

sentences.english: Only I got so bored, I just thought I'd treat myself to a visit to town.
sentences.chinese: 只是我覺得煩得慌，所以想到鎮上來轉轉。

sentences.english: For example: John is such an egghead, he should get out more and enjoy himself。
sentences.chinese: 約翰都快成書呆子了，他應該多出去轉轉，放鬆一下。

sentences.english: Beijing is my turf . I'll show you around, I know it really well.
sentences.chinese: 北京是我的地盤，我帶你轉轉，這兒我太熟了。

sentences.english: I hope I will be able to show you around. I'm sure you'll impressed.
sentences.chinese: 我希望能帶您到處轉轉，您一定會留下深刻的印象。

sentences.english: Please let me guide you around this area to find the best restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 讓我來帶你周圍轉轉看哪家餐館最好。

sentences.english: After satisfying your inner poet, head cross the river and walk through Parque Forestal to the Fine Arts Museum.
sentences.chinese: 釋放了內心的詩意後，過河去聖地亞哥美術館轉轉。

sentences.english: You can enjoy yourself in the rotating cocktail bar on the top floor.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在頂樓的轉轉雞尾酒吧裏享受一下。

sentences.english: Shall I show you first visit to our showroom?
sentences.chinese: 我帶您到我們的展示室去轉轉好嗎？

sentences.english: Turn the wheel to the right to correct the steering .
sentences.chinese: 把方向盤往右邊轉轉，以便修正駕駛上的偏差。

sentences.english: I was flying in ever-diminishing circles.
sentences.chinese: 我在一個越來越小的圈子裏兜兜轉轉。

definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to go with sb/to form companionships

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
